title: Conservation of energy - sled on hill

content.question: A sled is traveling with speed <math alttext="v sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> along flat ground when it reaches a hill. The sled moves up the hill to a flat section of height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> where it has speed <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>, as shown. Friction between the sled and the ground is negligible. What is the sled’s final speed <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of 2 g h, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi></msqrt></math>
